name: Humanitarian Data Exchange (HDX)
description: Global repository of humanitarian datasets (COD/FOD, population, health, hazards, etc.).
notes: Hosts Common Operational Datasets (CODs) & many crisis datasets; API available. | Other type(s): exposure/infrastructure

name: Global Disaster Alert and Coordination System (GDACS)
description: Global multi-hazard alerts (earthquakes, tsunamis, tropical cyclones, floods, volcanoes) and situation maps.
notes: Offers RSS/GeoRSS feeds and API endpoints for some products.

name: IFRC GO Platform
description: Operational platform for Red Cross/Red Crescent operations, appeals, maps and datasets.
organization: International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies (IFRC)
notes: Many resources open; some partner content may require login. | Other type(s): multi-hazard

name: U.S. Drought Monitor
description: The U.S. Drought Monitor (USDM) is a map released every Thursday, showing where drought is and how bad it is across the U.S. and its territories.

name: Planscape
description: Planscape Forest Treatment Tool

name: USGS Earthquake Catalog API
description: Real-time and historical earthquake detections with magnitudes, locations and times.
notes: Supports GeoJSON; includes near-real-time feeds.

name: ReliefWeb API
description: Humanitarian information service with reports, maps, jobs; provides an API for programmatic access.
notes: Filter by disaster type, country, theme; JSON API. | Other type(s): eo/rapid mapping

name: NASA Disasters Mapping Portal
description: Near real-time NASA satellite layers, event dashboards and analysis for disasters.
notes: Includes ARIA Damage Proxy Maps and many NRT satellite products. | Other type(s): multi-hazard

name: Copernicus Emergency Management Service (EMS) – Rapid Mapping
description: On-demand rapid mapping for disasters in the EU and globally (activation products: damage, flood extent, etc.).
notes: Activation-dependent; products downloadable as vector/raster; Risk/Early Warning components (EFAS, EFFIS, GloFAS).

name: UNOSAT (UNITAR) Rapid Mapping
description: Satellite analysis maps and datasets for disasters and conflicts; live map portal.
notes: Some vector data downloadable per event; operations page lists latest products. | Other type(s): eo/rapid mapping

name: ACAPS
description: Independent analysis and datasets to support humanitarian decision-making (needs, severity, constraints).
notes: Not strictly hazard telemetry; complements operational data with context. | Other type(s): eo/rapid mapping

name: MapAction Maps & Data Hub
description: Curated maps, data and guidance produced during emergencies.
notes: Often linked to specific emergency deployments. | Other type(s): multi-hazard

name: Pacific Disaster Center (PDC) – DisasterAWARE (Public)
description: Global multi-hazard alerts and situational awareness map (public view).
notes: API/advanced access requires partnership or subscription.

name: USGS Earthquake Catalog API
description: Real-time and historical earthquake detections with magnitudes, locations and times.
notes: Supports GeoJSON; includes near-real-time feeds.

name: USGS ShakeMap
description: Maps of ground shaking intensity (MMI), peak ground acceleration/velocity for significant earthquakes.
notes: Event-dependent; provides GIS grids/layers.

name: USGS PAGER
description: Prompt Assessment of Global Earthquakes for Response: estimates of fatalities and economic losses.
notes: Includes alert levels (Green–Red) and exposure summaries.

name: EMSC Real-time Earthquake Data
description: European-Mediterranean Seismological Centre – global near-real-time earthquake detections and notifications.
notes: JSON feeds, push notifications and web tools.

name: GEOFON Global Earthquake Catalogue
description: GFZ Potsdam global earthquake catalogue and waveform access.
organization: GFZ German Research Centre for Geosciences
notes: CSV/XML exports available.

name: NOAA NWS Tsunami Warning Centers (PTWC, NTWC)
description: Official tsunami watches, advisories, and warnings; data and bulletins.
notes: Products also via CAP/JSON; regional centers issue products.

name: IOC Sea Level Station Monitoring Facility
description: Status and recent sea level observations from global tide gauge networks.
notes: Includes station lists, latency and performance metrics. | Other type(s): multi-hazard

name: JMA Tsunami & Earthquake Information
description: Japan Meteorological Agency tsunami warnings/advisories and earthquake info.
notes: Official national source; English pages provided.

name: USGS Volcano Hazards Program
description: Monitoring, alerts and hazard information for US volcanoes; maps & data.
notes: Includes observatory pages and maps; VNS email alerts available.

name: USGS Volcano Notification Service (VNS)
description: Free email notifications for volcanic activity at US-monitored volcanoes.
notes: Subscription service; complements web updates.

name: Smithsonian Global Volcanism Program (GVP)
description: Global volcano database and weekly activity reports.
notes: Holocene eruption database; collaborative weekly reports with USGS. | Other type(s): volcano

name: NOAA NCEI Global Volcano Locations
description: Volcano locations and attributes compiled with Smithsonian sources.
notes: Also mirrored on data.gov. | Other type(s): volcano

name: NOAA National Hurricane Center (NHC)
description: Official tropical cyclone advisories, best tracks, forecast cones (Atlantic & East Pacific).
notes: Shapefiles/KMZ available per advisory; RSS feeds.

name: Joint Typhoon Warning Center (JTWC)
description: Tropical cyclone warnings for Western Pacific, Indian Ocean and more.
notes: Public products; official RSMCs vary by basin.

name: IMD RSMC New Delhi – Tropical Cyclone
description: Official advisories & track data for Bay of Bengal and Arabian Sea.
notes: Includes e-Atlas and best track archives.

name: RSMC La Réunion – Météo-France
description: Official tropical cyclone warnings for the South-West Indian Ocean.
notes: English pages available; operational bulletins.

name: RSMC Nadi – Fiji Meteorological Service
description: Official tropical cyclone warnings for the South-West Pacific.
notes: Public alerts and situation products.

name: NASA FIRMS (MODIS/VIIRS Active Fire)
description: Near real-time active fire detections and burned area products.
notes: CSV/GeoJSON APIs; NRT layers available in web maps.

name: EFFIS – European Forest Fire Information System
description: EU wildfire monitoring (danger, perimeters, burned areas).
notes: Burned area datasets downloadable; analyst-curated perimeters.

name: Global Wildfire Information System (GWIS)
description: Global wildfire danger forecasts and near-real-time activity dashboards.
notes: Includes Current Situation Viewer and statistics portals.

name: InciWeb – Incident Information System
description: Official US interagency incident pages for wildfires and other incidents.
notes: Incident-specific maps and narrative updates.

name: NIFC Open Data
description: National Interagency Fire Center open datasets (perimeters, incidents, etc.).
notes: Varies by season; REST services available.

name: GloFAS – Global Flood Awareness System
description: Global flood forecasts with probabilistic outlooks and river discharge anomalies.
notes: API and map services available after free registration.

name: EFAS – European Flood Awareness System
description: Flood forecasts and situation for Europe; watches and reports.
notes: Subset public; partners have extended access.

name: USGS National Water Information System (NWIS)
description: Real-time streamflow, stage and water quality from US gauge network.
notes: JSON services available; long-term archives.

name: NOAA Water (AHPS River Observations)
description: River forecasts and observed hydrographs for US locations.
notes: Includes Advanced Hydrologic Prediction Service (AHPS).

name: UMD/NASA Global Flood Monitoring System (GFMS)
description: Satellite/rainfall-based flood detection/forecasting at global scale.
notes: Research/operational hybrid; web layers available.

name: Dartmouth Flood Observatory (DFO)
description: Catalog of large flood events worldwide with maps and metrics.
notes: Long-running archive; methods vary by era.

name: NOAA/NWS Weather API
description: Forecasts, observations and alerts via API.
notes: Alerts also available in CAP XML and ATOM feeds.

name: NWS Alerts (CAP)
description: Common Alerting Protocol (CAP) feeds for NWS watches, warnings, advisories.
notes: CAP v1.2; JSON-LD indexes via api.weather.gov.

name: AirNow API
description: Real-time US AQI observations and forecasts; Fire & Smoke map layers.
notes: GeoJSON/JSON; AQI health categories.

name: OpenAQ
description: Global aggregated open air quality data and API.
notes: Also mirrored on AWS Open Data; extensive docs.

name: Copernicus Atmosphere Monitoring Service (CAMS)
description: Global/regional air composition & AQ forecasts; NRT model outputs.
notes: Data via Copernicus Data Store and APIs; guidance & tutorials available.

name: NASA Worldview (EOSDIS)
description: Interactive browsing/downloading of 1200+ global satellite layers, many NRT.
notes: Supports downloading underlying data; snapshots tool available. | Other type(s): eo/rapid mapping

name: NASA Earthdata Search
description: Search and access NASA Earth science datasets and granules.
notes: Requires free Earthdata Login for downloads/API tokens. | Other type(s): catalog/platform

name: USGS EarthExplorer (Landsat, others)
description: Query and order satellite imagery, aerial photos and cartographic products.
notes: Bulk downloads and APIs available for some collections. | Other type(s): eo/rapid mapping

name: Copernicus Data Space Ecosystem
description: Open access to Sentinel data with APIs for catalog, download, visualization and processing.
notes: Replaced legacy SciHub; Streamlined Data Access APIs provided. | Other type(s): eo/rapid mapping

name: Maxar Open Data Program
description: High-resolution pre/post-event imagery released for select disasters.
notes: COG/ARD imagery hosted on AWS; STAC metadata available. | Other type(s): eo/rapid mapping

name: OpenAerialMap
description: Community-contributed aerial/satellite imagery for humanitarian mapping.
notes: Licensing varies by contributor; check per item. | Other type(s): eo/rapid mapping

name: NASA ARIA Damage Proxy Maps
description: Rapid SAR-based damage proxy maps for major disasters.
notes: Event-dependent coverage; not a replacement for field verification. | Other type(s): eo/rapid mapping

name: NOAA GOES Imagery (GOES-East/West)
description: Near real-time geostationary imagery for the Americas.
notes: Sectorized imagery; animations and file downloads.

name: WorldPop
description: Gridded population datasets (constrained/unconstrained), demographics.
notes: Country and global products; various vintages. | Other type(s): exposure/infrastructure

name: Global Human Settlement Layer (GHSL)
description: Global built-up areas and population layers from EO and census.
notes: Multiple epochs; check license and resolution by product. | Other type(s): exposure/infrastructure

name: High Resolution Settlement Layer (HRSL)
description: Building-based population estimates for select countries.
notes: Coverage limited; see country list on site/HDX mirrors. | Other type(s): exposure/infrastructure

name: Microsoft Building Footprints (Open Data)
description: Hundreds of millions of extracted building footprints for many countries.
notes: License allows OSM integration; coverage varies by country. | Other type(s): exposure/infrastructure

name: OpenStreetMap (OSM)
description: Crowdsourced global geospatial data: roads, buildings, POIs, landuse.
notes: Access via Overpass API, planet dumps, and mirrored extracts. | Other type(s): exposure/infrastructure

name: OSM – Overpass API
description: Query OSM features by tags/geometry for targeted extracts.
notes: Rate limits apply; multiple public instances available. | Other type(s): exposure/infrastructure

name: OCHA COD/FOD (Common Operational Datasets)
description: Official admin boundaries and foundational datasets for humanitarian operations.
notes: Includes administrative boundaries, P-codes, settlements, more. | Other type(s): admin/base

name: geoBoundaries
description: Open, standardized political administrative boundaries for every country.
notes: Multiple hierarchy levels; versioned releases. | Other type(s): admin/base

name: GADM
description: Global Administrative Areas database (non-commercial license).
notes: Non-commercial use only – check license. | Other type(s): admin/base

name: EIA Open Data (Electric System Operating Data)
description: US grid balancing authority load, generation and interchange (EIA-930).
notes: API access to hourly/daily series; dashboards available. | Other type(s): multi-hazard

name: HIFLD Open (ArcGIS Hub)
description: Homeland Infrastructure Foundation-Level Data (various national facility/infrastructure layers).
notes: Portal slated for discontinuation in 2025; many layers mirrored on Data.gov. | Other type(s): multi-hazard

name: US National Flood Hazard Layer (NFHL)
description: Authoritative FEMA flood hazard mapping and services.
notes: Also available as REST/WMS services; see FEMA GIS pages.

name: FEMA National Risk Index (NRI)
description: Nationwide risk metrics by hazard, county/tract-level EAL and vulnerability.
notes: Downloads as GDB/CSV/shapefiles; methodology docs provided. | Other type(s): multi-hazard

name: FEMA OpenFEMA
description: FEMA program datasets, disaster declarations, IA/PA data via API and downloads.
notes: REST API base: https://www.fema.gov/api/open . | Other type(s): multi-hazard

name: FEMA Open Shelters (NSS)
description: Live open shelters feed synchronized with Red Cross shelter database.
notes: Updates multiple times daily via ESF6-SS synchronization. | Other type(s): multi-hazard

name: PowerOutage.us (Public Map)
description: Aggregated power outage counts by utility/state/county in the US.
notes: API available via paid products; ~10-minute refresh on site. | Other type(s): multi-hazard

name: PowerOutage REST API (Products)
description: Paid API for live outage data including utility polygons.
notes: Covers US/Canada/UK; includes GeoJSON outage shapes. | Other type(s): multi-hazard

name: Cloudflare Radar
description: Global and regional Internet traffic/quality trends; insights on disruptions.
notes: Sub-national insights, ASN pages; blog posts on major incidents. | Other type(s): multi-hazard

name: NetBlocks Internet Observatory
description: Independent measurement and reporting of Internet disruptions and shutdowns.
notes: Open reports; raw data access subject to policies. | Other type(s): context/security

name: RIPE Atlas
description: Crowdsourced Internet measurement network; REST and streaming APIs.
notes: Public measurement results; streaming API for real-time feeds. | Other type(s): multi-hazard

name: Waze for Cities Data
description: Partner program providing traffic incidents, jams and road closure sharing.
notes: GeoRSS/JSON feeds in Partner Hub; BigQuery access for analytics. | Other type(s): multi-hazard

name: 511 SF Bay – Work Zone Data Exchange (WZDx)
description: Regional WZDx feed for planned/active closures and detours.
notes: Endpoint pattern: http://api.511.org/traffic/wzdx?api_key=... | Other type(s): multi-hazard

name: 511NY Developers API
description: State 511 REST API for incidents, alerts, cameras, message signs.
notes: Multiple resource endpoints documented.

name: 511 Wisconsin Developers
description: Real-time traffic/transit events, incidents, projects and camera images.
notes: Single access point for public 511WI info. | Other type(s): multi-hazard

name: Iowa DOT 511 (Data.gov)
description: 511 feature layer updated ~every 10 minutes.
notes: Event feed mirrored via ArcGIS feature layer. | Other type(s): multi-hazard

name: WFP Logistics Cluster – LogIE/Access Maps
description: Operational logistics information, access constraints and assessments.
notes: Country pages include access maps, port/road status, contacts. | Other type(s): multi-hazard/coordination

name: WHO Health Emergency Dashboard
description: WHO-monitored public health events and emergencies dashboard.
notes: Data refresh frequency indicated on site; scope varies by event. | Other type(s): health/food security

name: PAHO/WHO Health Emergencies Dashboards
description: Regional dashboards for the Americas (COVID-19 and other health threats).
notes: Includes disease-specific dashboards and variants tracking. | Other type(s): health/food security

name: CDC/ATSDR Social Vulnerability Index (SVI)
description: Census-tract and county-level social vulnerability metrics (US).
notes: Downloads and documentation available (multiple years). | Other type(s): multi-hazard

name: INFORM Risk Index
description: Global open-source risk assessment for humanitarian crises and disasters.
notes: Data downloads and methodology available via DRMKC/HDX. | Other type(s): eo/rapid mapping

name: World Bank Open Data (Indicators API)
description: Global development indicators useful for vulnerability and capacity analysis.
notes: Indicators API provides programmatic access to time series. | Other type(s): multi-hazard

name: US Census – American Community Survey (ACS) API
description: Demographic, housing, economic data for the US via API.
notes: Multiple datasets and years; JSON API. | Other type(s): terrain/hydrography

name: Red Cross – Find Open Shelters
description: Public map of active open shelters and service sites.
notes: Shelter visibility may vary by event and partner reporting. | Other type(s): multi-hazard

name: HIFLD – National Shelter System Facilities (archival)
description: Shelter facilities points historically published via HIFLD/DHS.
notes: HIFLD Open portal is being discontinued; use FEMA services for live data. | Other type(s): multi-hazard

name: USGS Volcano Updates (status & alerts)
description: Status updates and alert level changes for US volcanoes.
notes: Complements VNS email notifications.

name: USGS Landslide Hazard Program – Inventories
description: Landslide inventories and hazard info (US).
notes: Coverage varies; explore state/region pages. | Other type(s): multi-hazard

name: NASA Global Landslide Catalog
description: Global catalog of rainfall-triggered landslides from media & scientific reports.
notes: Crowdsourced elements; not exhaustive. | Other type(s): catalog/platform

name: 511 Iowa Website
description: Public statewide traveler information including closures and conditions.
notes: Feature layer also on Data.gov; see separate entry. | Other type(s): multi-hazard/coordination

name: 511 Wisconsin Website
description: State traveler information site with incidents, cameras and construction.
notes: Developer resources available. | Other type(s): multi-hazard/coordination

name: 511 New York Website
description: State traveler information: events, closures, cameras.
notes: API documentation linked on site. | Other type(s): multi-hazard/coordination

name: CRASAR U-DROIDs (sUAS Disaster Imagery Dataset)
description: Benchmark dataset for building damage assessment in georectified sUAS imagery.
organization: Center for Robot-Assisted Search and Rescue (CRASAR)
notes: Research dataset; terms as specified in paper. | Other type(s): eo/rapid mapping

name: OpenInfraMap
description: Crowd-derived power infrastructure mapping (lines, substations) from OSM.
notes: Derived from OSM; accuracy varies. | Other type(s): exposure/infrastructure

name: Global Administrative data – Natural Earth
description: Cultural/physical vector layers (boundaries, populated places, roads).
notes: Small/medium/large scales; public domain. | Other type(s): admin/base

name: NOAA Storm Prediction Center (SPC)
description: US severe weather outlooks, watches, mesoscale discussions and reports.
notes: GIS shapefiles and KML available for some products.

name: NOAA National Weather Service – CAP Documentation
description: Documentation and resources for consuming NWS CAP alerts.
notes: CAP v1.2 details and examples.

name: OurAirports
description: Open data about airports and runways worldwide.
notes: Community-maintained; validate locally before operations. | Other type(s): exposure/infrastructure

name: USGS 3D Elevation Program (3DEP)
description: High-res elevation (LiDAR/IFSAR) for the US.
notes: Availability varies by state; check lidar status maps. | Other type(s): terrain/hydrography

name: Natural Hazards – NASA IMERG (GPM)
description: Global precipitation estimates (half-hourly) useful for flood and landslide nowcasting.
notes: Multiple latency products (Early/Final).

name: NOAA Storm Prediction Center (SPC)
description: Severe weather outlooks, tornado probabilities, watches, mesoscale discussions (U.S.).
notes: U.S.-focused convective hazards.

name: NOAA NWS Tornado Warnings (CAP/RSS)
description: Machine-readable CAP/RSS feeds carrying U.S. tornado warnings and other hazards.
notes: Filter CAP for event='TOR'.

name: NOAA NCEI Storm Events Database (Tornadoes)
description: Historical severe weather events including tornado tracks, impacts, and narratives (U.S.).
notes: Archive back to 1950; CSV/API.

name: NOAA Weather Prediction Center (WPC) – Excessive Rainfall Outlook (ERO)
description: National risk outlook for flash flooding (Days 1–3).
notes: Operational guidance for flood risk.

name: World Air Quality Index (WAQI)
description: Global real-time AQI and station observations.
notes: Useful for smoke and pollution impacts.

name: Canadian Wildland Fire Information System (CWFIS)
description: Fire danger, hotspots, and situation reports for Canada.
notes: Canada-focused complement to FIRMS.

name: PowerOutage.us
description: Crowdsourced + utility-reported power outage tracking for U.S. states/counties.
notes: Proxy for storm impact and priorities. | Other type(s): lifelines

name: Esri Disaster Response Program (DRP)
description: GIS support and curated event layers for responders upon request.
notes: Contact for activation; resources vary. | Other type(s): multi-hazard/coordination

name: Copernicus EMS Rapid Mapping
description: On-demand satellite rapid mapping for emergencies in EU and partner activations.
notes: Activation-based products; many public. | Other type(s): eo/rapid mapping
